title: [Large-scale] Pressure Swing Adsorption (PSA) Optimization Design for Radon Removal Processes

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational chemical engineering theory, differential equations comprehension, basic optimization algorithm concepts
context.additional_context: LMS-based asynchronous learning environment, with access to practical and simulation tools utilizing digital devices.

learning_goals: Learners can mathematically model conditions to achieve over 90% efficiency in removing radioactive krypton (85Kr) in PSA process design
Genetic algorithms can be utilized to derive optimal parameters (pressure, adsorption time, temperature, etc.) for the PSA process
Applying iterative learning design enables adjustment of optimal design parameters in response to changing process conditions
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
